metadata.title: FA Analyze 32 05

config.question: Following the noticeably high Latino vote that came out for Barack Obama in 2012, some in the Republican party __________.

choices.content: reconsidered their position in the immigration debate
reconsidered their position on the abortion issue
began pursuing aggressive deportation of children of illegal immigrants
began contributing heavily to Hispanic candidates in their party

answer_3.response: Consider This: Obama won reelection in 2012. While their party’s defeat in that presidential election led some Republicans to enter 2013 appearing a bit more willing to compromise, it left the most conservative members of the party as determined as ever to hold the line against Obama’s initiatives. See L.O. 32.5 Barack Obama’s Triumph and Trials.
